teamSkills.cyrilleDescription:
Cyrille Nahabedian is the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer at Heroics Capital Partners. With nearly 20 years of experience in European capital markets, Cyrille oversees the organization's overall activities. He ensures the implementation of the strategy and reports key outcomes to the shareholders. As CEO, he co-validates the company's investment decisions and recommendations, and actively engages with key clients. He also supervises the main recruitement and talent development programs within the organization.
Before founding Heroics Capital in January 2023, Cyrille held exeucitve positions at Cr√©dit Agricole IWM Group, notably as Global Head of Capital Markets Divison, where he managed the global capital markets strategy and projects. He also led trading teams across Europe, specializing in derivatives. A graduate of Skema Business School with a Master's in Capital Markets Management and holding a Research Master's in Capital Markets from Paris I Sorbonne University, Cyrille continues to share his expertise as a lecturer for Professional Master's programs at the Ecole Sup√©rieure de Commerce de Paris.
teamSkills.alexDescription:
As a Co-Founder and Partner at Heorics Capital, Alexandre Tramini harnesses his financial expertise ad entrepreneurial spirit to empower innovative startups and social enterprises. With over 17 years of experience in investment banking and wealth management, he has honed strong skills in corporate finance and capital markets, along with a profound understanding of the needs and challenges faced by high-net-worth clients and family offices.
Previously, Alexandre served as the European Head of Capital Markets Sales at CA Indosuez Wealth Management, where he led a team of sales professionals and advised clients on hedging and investment strategies across various asset classes. From 2014 to 2023, in collaboration with his partners, he launched a groundbreaking capital markets initiative with CA Indosuez Wealth Management, specializing in trading and advisory services. This initiative revitalized the private banking offering, addressing the unique needs of entrepreneurs, family offices and UHNWIs while enhancing synergies with investment banking solutions.
Alexandre graduated from Kedge Business School and holds two postgradute degrees: a Master's in Financial Engineering and a Master's in Banking and Wealth Law.
teamSkills.joDescription:
Jonathan Niddam is the Co-Founder and Head of Research and Trading at Heroics Capital in Luxembourg. With over a decade of experience in finance, particularly in FX and stock options trading, he advises UHNW investors across markets such as precious metals, FX, equity and fixed income, while managing alternative portfolios.
He leads Heroics Capital's Research and Trading, applying advanced data techniques to enhanced investment strategies. his nearly ten-year tenure at Indosuez Wealth Management, specializing in OTC derivatives and technology integration, has shaped his approach to portfolio and risk management. His expertise allows him to deliver sophisticated, customized solutions that keep Heroics Capital's strategies agile, data-driven and innovative.
teamSkills.ilyasseDescription:
As a Quantitative Trader, Ilyasse Tariq is responsible for developing advanced quantitative strategies, identifying alpha generation opportunities, and designing robust portfolio construction and risk management methods. In the past, he has held diverse positions, notably as an Exotic Equity Derivatives Trader at several major investment banks. In these roles, he specialized in managing complex financial products, including options, derivatives, and structured equity solutions, focusing on market volatility and risk hedging strategies. His expertise in exotic equity trading allowed him to navigate intricate market scenarios, optimizing trading performance.
He holds a degree in Telecommunication Engineering from the Ecole Nationale Sup√©rieure Mines-T√©l√©com Atlantique, as well as an MSc in Risk and Finance and a Master's in Financial Economics from EDHEC Business School, where he conducted his thesis under the supervision of Nikolaos Tessaromatis, Chairman of the Board at the Greek Pension Fund.
teamSkills.bakDescription:
Bak's professional career began as a Portfolio Manager and then as an Auditor at Cr√©dit Agricole, one of France's leading banks. In this role, he was responsible for conducting thorough financial audits and assessments, which provided him with valuable insights into the banking and financial sectors. His analytical skills and attention to detail were pivotal during this phase of his career.
Following his tenure at Cr√©dit Agricole, Bak took various management roles at BGL BNP Paribas in Luxembourg. Here, he was involved in overseeing financial operations and team management, where he developed leadership skills and gained experience in navigating complex financial landscapes. His contributions helped streamline processes and improve operational efficiency within the organization.
Bak Khieng Ung also demonstrated his entrepreneurial spirit by establishing an individual enterprise that operated for 5 years, focusing on retail sales through automated vending and non-store retail activities. Based in Neuilly-Sur-Seine, this venture showcased his ability to identify market opportunities and adapt to changing consumer behaviors. The enterprise thrived until its closure in February 2016, marking a significant chapter in his professional journey.
teamSkills.pierreDescription: Pierre Leonard is chief accountant at Heroics Capital Partners. With 25 years servicing international Real Estate and Private Equity clients with Luxembourg services providers, Pierre gained an extensive management, accounting and tax advisory background with expertise in Domiciliation, Corporate Management, Tax and Accounting, as well as sound knowledge of investment structures, Soparfi, SPF and Regulated entities. He holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting and Management from HELMO, as well as degrees in Luxembourg Corporate Tax, and Luxembourg Corporate Law.  He is also a non-registered chartered accountant since 2006.

posts.title: Heroics Capital at the Monaco Grand Prix: Precision on and off the Track
posts.content:
Heroics Capital was proud to be on home ground as the Monaco Grand Prix returned to the legendary streets of Monte Carlo this May. With one of our desks based in Monaco, this iconic race weekend is not only a highlight on the Formula 1 calendar, but also a moment of strategic visibility for our team and partners.

Our presence at the Grand Prix is more than symbolic ‚Äî it reflects the precision, performance, and pace that drive both motorsports and our investment strategies. Like F1 teams, we operate in high-stakes environments where real-time analysis, sharp execution, and continuous innovation are paramount.

We hosted select partners during the event to celebrate not just the race, but the shared values that connect elite sport and institutional finance: control, discipline, and a relentless pursuit of excellence.

posts.title: First European hedge fund to trade a BTC over-the-counter derivative with Goldman Sachs Europe.
posts.content: In July 2024, Heroics Global Strategy SICAV-RAIF made a historic milestone by becoming the first European hedge fund to execute an OTC derivative product on Bitcoin with Goldman Sachs Europe. This transaction demonstrates the growing integration of digital assets into institutional investment strategies and paves the way for greater adoption of crypto-asset derivatives. This development highlights Heroics Global Strategy's pioneering role in financial sector innovation. Heroics Capital, the fund's parent company, stands out as a key player specializing in alternative investment strategies and innovative technologies.
